definition[0]: to tear a piece of paper or cloth into small pieces
example[0]: She tore up his letter and threw it away.
definition[1]: to remove something from the ground by pulling or pushing it violently
example[1]: the remains of trees that had been torn up by the storm
definition[2]: to say that you no longer accept an agreement or contract
example[2]: threats to tear up the peace agreement
definition[3]: to have fun in an extreme way
definition[4]: to do something, for example play music or dance, very well on a particular occasion
definition[5]: if you are tearing up, you are starting to have tears in your eyes because you feel very sad, happy etc
example[3]: As she waved her mother goodbye, she found herself tearing up.
